awd_titl_txt: Auroral Oval Over the Past Century and a Half
awd_abstract_narration: This project will attempt to understand the long term (150 year)                behavior of the auroral oval, and by extension, of the solar wind by            examining and analyzing historical auroral observations.  The sources of        data include Greenland meteorological observations, ship logs from polar        exploration cruises, books and articles form Arctic and Antarctic               expeditions and Canadian and American stations.                                                                                                                 The principal Investigator is the leading U.S. researcher of historical         geomagnetic effects.  It is possible that the results of this study will        be useful in designing future systems, such as satellite communications         systems, that are effected by auroral phenomena.                                                                                                                The project is jointly supported by the Division of Polar Programs and          the Division of Atmospheric Sciences.
